intro: Ageratum angustifolium, commonly known as narrowleaf ageratum, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, showy blue to violet flowers. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens. Ageratum angustifolium is also used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
